questions.text: What did Mon-El think had more information that Youtube?
questions.explanation:
Books.

	He was attempting to make Kara breakfast in bed, but she woke up and spoiled that. When she asked him about where he learned to poach an egg, he picked up a cookbook and gave the line about books having more useful information than Youtube in them.

questions.text: Supergirl rushed out to stop an alien from attacking the city. What did Mon-El stay behind to do?
questions.explanation:
Laundry.

	At first he was going to go with her and also fight the alien. Then he realized his suit, or "stuff" as he called it, was at the DEO. By that time Kara was already in her Supergirl outfit and said she had this one. He yelled after her that he'd stay behind and get started on the laundry.

questions.text: There was an intergalactic bounty placed on Supergirl.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In fact, it's the entire basis of the episode. The bounty was large enough to buy a planet, according to Mon-El. The bounty called her the "Last daughter of Krypton".

questions.text: Mon-El met with his parents to talk about his relationship with Kara. Where did they meet?
questions.explanation:
In a bar.

	They met up in the bar where Mon-El worked as a bartender. His father was played by Kevin Sorbo (known for playing Hercules in "Hercules: The Legendary Journeys") and Teri Hatcher (known for playing Lois Lane in "Lois and Clark: The New Adventures of Superman").

questions.text: Queen Rhea used what type of weapon to attack Kara?
questions.explanation:
Sai.

	She used a pair of sais that appeared to be either made completely out of or at least laced with Kryptonite. Kara, Rhea, and Mon-El were meeting int he Fortress of Solitude to discuss his happiness on Earth. Rhea told Kara that she got the Kryptonite from her home world, which was "littered" with the corpse of Kara's world.

Emily.

	Emily bumped into them while they were on a date. Maggie told Alex that Emily had dumped her and told her that she didn't deserve to be happy. What Maggie failed to mention was that she had cheated on Emily before the dumping.

questions.text: Who ordered J'onn not to engage with the Daxomite ship?
questions.explanation:
President Marsdin.

	President Marsdin was played by Lynda Carter (known for her role as Wonder Woman on the 1970s show of the same name). She ordered the DEO to not engage with the alien ship at all because it could start an interplanetary war.

questions.text: How far away from Earth is Daxom by ship?
questions.explanation:
4 years.

	Rhea, while arguing with Mon-El, told him the trip to their home world would take four years. She threatened to have him held in a cell the entire time so he could think about why returning to his home planet to serve as the prince was truly what was best for him.

questions.text: Who did the Martian Manhunter impersonate?
questions.explanation:
Supergirl.

	Knowing Rhea had Kryptonite, J'onn J'onzz (The Martian Manhunter) went to her ship disguised as Kara rather than letting Kara go herself. The ruse was revealed when the Kryptonite didn't affect "her" in any way. Kara later joined the fight as well.

questions.text: Mon-El returned to his home planet.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Lar Gand, the king of Daxam, stopped the battle on his ship after watching his son attack the ship to help the other side win. He announced that Mon-El had "made his decision" and agreed to leave him on Earth.Rhea, Mon-El's mother, declared that Krypton had taken everything from her, but didn't stop him from staying on Earth.
